Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
I'm checking on Automake tools and trying to compile `libnspv` as library file instead of binary `nspv`.
I see the `Makefile.am` has this to compile nspv.c and it's .h header files including the defined header and .a library files to compile it as a binary.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: still fairly fresh to understand automake tools, so I tried adding this to make library, which is a copy of the program, but with additional change

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: nspv program compile part in Makefile.am

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```
inst_PROGRAMS += nspv
nspv_LDADD = libbtc.la $(LIBCRYPTOCONDITIONS) -lpthread -lsodium
nspv_SOURCES = \
src/tools/nspv.c 
nspv_CFLAGS = $(libbtc_la_CFLAGS) -O2  -Wno-unused-parameter
nspv_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/src
nspv_LDFLAGS = -static
```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I added this to make a library

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```lib_LTLIBRARIES = libnspv.la
noinst_LTLIBRARIES=libnspv.la
include_HEADERS = \
    libnspv_LDADD = libbtc.la $(LIBCRYPTOCONDITIONS) -lpthread -lsodium
    libnspv_SOURCES = \
    src/tools/nspv.c
    libnspv_CFLAGS = $(libbtc_la_CFLAGS) -O2  -Wno-unused-parameter
    libnspv_CPPFLAGS = -I$(top_srcdir)/src
    # libnspv_LDFLAGS = -static
```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the reason I wanted to have a `libnspv.a` library was to embed it with the iOS or Android app

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: as little as I know, these apps prefer to have the library files included in them

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and call the functions, methods from that library and use them

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: so my hope is when I get to the point making a mobile app, I could be able to use this `.a` library file in it and start nspv through that app and we can have a mobile app nSPV client

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
I read about submarine swaps between onchain coins and offchain Lightning Network coins. They made it work on BTC, LTC and ETH. I don't know if a submarine swap (onchain altcoins paid to pay a LN invoice) can work on KMD/ZEC. I didn't read on inverse submarive swaps.
<https://medium.com/@jason.hcwong/atomic-on-chain-ltc-to-off-chain-btc-swap-811565f86166>
<https://demandsolutionsnews.com/submarine-swaps/>
<https://github.com/submarineswaps/swaps-service>

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Websites such as <https://swapready.net/> doesn't show submarine swap readyness and as a submarine swap requires HTLC on KMD, maybe it is possible (no malleability fix needed)

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Maybe it was never tested but I think that KMD supports HTLC and timelocks so it should be possible to do a submarine swap KMD/LN BTC ... and a later stage decentralize <https://submarineswaps.org/> for all cryptos on mm2

Author: phm87#7395
Content: Reverse submarine swap is another subject
